emerging_technologies.name: Energy Harvesting Nanofibers
emerging_technologies.description: Nanofibers capable of harvesting kinetic energy from movement or ambient energy to power small devices.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces reliance on batteries, promotes sustainability, but raises concerns about energy security.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Cost of production, efficiency in energy conversion, and integration into existing products.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Blockchain technology resistant to quantum computing attacks, ensuring long-term security of digital transactions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances trust in digital systems but requires widespread adoption to be effective.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Need for global standards, regulatory acceptance, and computational overhead.

emerging_technologies.name: AI-Enhanced Autonomous Maintenance Robots
emerging_technologies.description: Robots capable of performing predictive maintenance autonomously, reducing downtime in industrial settings.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Increases efficiency, reduces labor costs, but might displace certain jobs.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Initial investment cost, reliability of AI algorithms, and integration with existing systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Lace Technology
emerging_technologies.description: A mesh-like device that interfaces directly with the brain, enhancing or repairing cognitive functions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Profound ethical concerns regarding privacy, consent, and potential for misuse.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological maturity, regulatory approval, public acceptance, and ethical guidelines.

mainstream_technologies.name: 5G-Advanced
mainstream_technologies.description: Enhanced version of 5G providing faster speeds, lower latency, and more reliable connections.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in developed regions; expansion in developing areas depends on infrastructure investment.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Driven Personal Health Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems that monitor health metrics and provide personalized health advice.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in healthcare settings, with growing consumer market integration.

epoch_themes.description: Focus on creating cities that are environmentally sustainable, technologically advanced, and livable.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Reduces urban pollution, improves quality of life, but requires significant infrastructure changes.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased urban populations, climate change initiatives, and push towards zero-emission cities.

epoch_themes.description: Advancements in managing digital identity with an emphasis on privacy and security.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Strengthens personal data protection but could lead to surveillance concerns.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Rising cyber threats, data breaches, and regulatory pushes for data protection laws.
